description.text:
An optional arial label for the `<nav>` element in this component.
This prop is necessary when there is more than one nav element on a page.
Additional classes to be added to the root element
Whether or not the menu is in a collapsed state

When provided, this will render the passed in component for all `VerticalNavItem`s. This is useful when
integrating with React Router's `<Link>` or using your own custom component.
If more specific control is needed, each `VerticalNavItem` object also accepts a `component` prop.

The `id` of the selected `VerticalNavItem`. This will also set the
`selected` prop on the item's parents.
An array of [`VerticalNavItem`]({{root}}/components/vertical-nav/#components.vertical-nav.VerticalNavItem) data objects
Indicates this list is nested within another nav item.

Called when one of the nav links is clicked, with the following arguments:
[`SyntheticEvent`](https://facebook.github.io/react/docs/events.html),
`id`, `url`

tsType.name: signature
tsType.raw: (evt: React.MouseEvent | React.KeyboardEvent, id: string, url: string) => any

description.text: @hide-prop This gets passed through from the parent VerticalNav to a nested VerticalNav
Aria label for the toggle button when the sub-navigation is collapsed
Aria label for the toggle button when the sub-navigation is expanded
Additional classes to be added to the root element

When provided, this will render the passed in component. This is useful when
integrating with React Router's `<Link>` or using your own custom component.
Whether or not the item's sub-navigation is in a collapsed state by default

Called when the link is clicked, with the following arguments:
[`SyntheticEvent`](https://facebook.github.io/react/docs/events.html),
`id`, `url`.
This takes precedence over the `VerticalNav` `onLinkClick` prop

tsType.name: signature
tsType.raw: (evt: React.MouseEvent | React.KeyboardEvent, id: string, url: string) => any

description.text:
Called when this item's subnav is collapsed or expanded, with the
following arguments: `id`, `collapsed`

Optional identifier. This can be handy if you're passing in an
`onClick` handler. A unique ID will be generated if one isn't provided.

An array of nested `VerticalNavItem` data objects to be rendered in a
sub-navigation list.
Text to render for this nav item
A URL to navigate to if this item is a link
If this item is currently selected
Additional classes to be added to the root `section` element
A unique ID to be applied to the banner content. A unique ID will be generated if one isn't provided.
Classes applied to the tooltip trigger when the tooltip is active
Helpful description of the tooltip for screenreaders
Tooltip trigger content
Classes applied to the tooltip trigger
Configurable text for the aria-label of the tooltip's close button
When provided, will render the passed in component for the tooltip trigger. Typically will be a `button`, `a`, or rarely an `input` element.
Heading for the tooltip content. This will show above 'title' content and inline with 'closeButton' if closeButton is set

Tooltip that behaves like a dialog, i.e. a tooltip that only appears on click, traps focus, and contains interactive content. For more information, see Deque's [tooltip dialog documentation](https://dequeuniversity.com/library/aria/tooltip-dialog)
`id` applied to tooltip body container element. If not provided, a unique id will be automatically generated and used.
Sets the size of the invisible border around interactive tooltips that prevents it from immediately hiding when the cursor leaves the tooltip.
Applies `skidding` and `distance` offsets to the tooltip relative to the trigger. See the [`popperjs` docs](https://popper.js.org/docs/v2/modifiers/popper-offsets/) for more info.
Called when the tooltip is hidden
Called when the tooltip is shown
Placement of the tooltip body relative to the trigger. See the [`popperjs` docs](https://popper.js.org/docs/v2/constructors/#options) for more info.
`maxWidth` styling applied to the tooltip body
Determines if close button is shown in tooltip. It is recommended that the close button is only used if `dialog=true`
Content inside the tooltip body or popover. If contains interactive elements use the `dialog` prop.
Duration of the `react-transition-group` CSSTransition. See the [`timeout` option](http://reactcommunity.org/react-transition-group/transition#Transition-prop-timeout) for more info.
`zIndex` styling applied to the tooltip body
Must contain a `TextField` component

Applies date format masking to the input value entered
and displays the formatted value above the input. See
'Label mask' documentation page for more information.
Passing `true` to `valueOnly` will return just the
formatted value entered.
Must contain a `TextField` component
The type of mask

Apply an `aria-label` to the text field to provide additional
context to assistive devices.
Additional classes to be added to the root `div` element

Sets the initial value. Use this for an uncontrolled component; otherwise,
use the `value` property.
Additional classes to be added to the error message
Location of the error message relative to the field input
Additional classes to be added to the field element
Used to focus `input` on `componentDidMount()`
Additional hint text to display
A unique `id` to be used on the text field.
Access a reference to the `input` or `textarea` element
Text showing the requirement ("Required", "Optional", etc.). See [Required and Optional Fields]({{root}}/guidelines/forms/#required-and-optional-fields).
Applies the "inverse" UI theme
Label for the input

Applies date format masking to the input value entered
and renders to a text field above the input.
Passing `true` to `valueOnly` will return just the
formatted value entered.
Additional classes to be added to the `FormLabel`.
A unique `id` to be used on the label field.

Apply formatting to the field that's unique to the value
you expect to be entered. Depending on the mask, the
field's appearance and functionality may be affected.
Whether or not the text field is a multiline text field

Sets `inputMode`, `type`, and `pattern` to improve accessibility and consistency for number fields. Use this prop instead of `type="number"`, see [here](https://technology.blog.gov.uk/2020/02/24/why-the-gov-uk-design-system-team-changed-the-input-type-for-numbers/) for more information.
@hide-prop HTML `input` [pattern](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#htmlattrdefpattern).

Optionally specify the number of visible text lines for the field. Only
applicable if this is a multiline field.
Set the max-width of the input either to `'small'` or `'medium'`.
HTML `input` [type](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#<input>_types) attribute. If you are using `type=number` please use the numeric prop instead.

Sets the input's `value`. Use this in combination with `onChange`
for a controlled component; otherwise, set `defaultValue`.

Apply an `aria-label` to the text field to provide additional
context to assistive devices.

Sets the initial value. Use this for an uncontrolled component; otherwise,
use the `value` property.
The ID of the error message applied to the Select field.
Location of the error message relative to the field input
Additional classes to be added to the field element
A unique `id` to be used on the text field.
Applies the "inverse" UI theme
Whether or not the text field is a multiline text field

Sets `inputMode`, `type`, and `pattern` to improve accessibility and consistency for number fields. Use this prop instead of `type="number"`, see [here](https://technology.blog.gov.uk/2020/02/24/why-the-gov-uk-design-system-team-changed-the-input-type-for-numbers/) for more information.
@hide-prop HTML `input` [pattern](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#htmlattrdefpattern).

Optionally specify the number of visible text lines for the field. Only
applicable if this is a multiline field.
Set the max-width of the input either to `'small'` or `'medium'`.
HTML `input` [type](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#<input>_types) attribute. If you are using `type=number` please use the numeric prop instead.

Sets the input's `value`. Use this in combination with `onChange`
for a controlled component; otherwise, set `defaultValue`.
Tab label text or HTML.
Additional classes to be added to the root tab element.
A unique `id`, to be used on the rendered tab element.

Sets the `href` attribute used for the tab. This can be useful if you want
to use relative links rather than a URL hash (the default).

Called when the tab is clicked, with the following arguments:
[`SyntheticEvent`](https://facebook.github.io/react/docs/events.html),
`panelId`, `id`, `href`

tsType.name: signature
tsType.raw: (evt: React.MouseEvent, panelId: string, id: string, href: string) => any

description.text:
Called when the tab is selected and a keydown event is triggered.
Called with the following arguments:
[`SyntheticEvent`](https://facebook.github.io/react/docs/events.html),
`panelId`, `id`, `href`

tsType.name: signature
tsType.raw: (evt: React.KeyboardEvent, panelId: string, id: string, href: string) => any

description.text: The `id` of the associated `TabPanel`. Used for the `aria-controls` attribute.
Additional classes to be added to the root element.
A unique `id`, to be used on the rendered panel element.

The associated tab's label. Only applicable when the panel is a
child of `Tabs`.

Additional classes for the associated tab. Only applicable when the panel
is a child of `Tabs`.

The associated tab's `href`. Only applicable when the panel is a
child of `Tabs`.
The `id` of the associated `Tab`. Used for the `aria-labelledby` attribute.
Must only contain `TabPanel` components

Sets the initial selected `TabPanel` state. If this isn't set, the first
`TabPanel` will be selected.

A callback function that's invoked when the selected tab is changed.
`(selectedId, prevSelectedId) => void`
Additional classes to be added to the component wrapping the tabs
Applies the borderless variation of the table.
The table contents, usually `TableCaption`, `TableHead` and `TableBody`.
Additional classes to be added to the root table element.
Applies the compact variation of the table.
@hide-prop [Deprecated] Use compact instead.
Applies a horizontal scrollbar and scrollable notice on `TableCaption` when the `Table`'s contents exceed the container width.

defaultValue.value: Scroll using arrow keys to see more

description.text:
Additional text or content to display when the horizontal scrollbar is visible to give the user notice of the scroll behavior.
This prop will only be used when the `Table` `scrollable` prop is set and the table width is wider than the viewport.

A stackable variation of the table.
When `stackable` is set, `id` or `headers` prop is required in `Table`
Applies responsive styles to vertically stacked rows at different viewport sizes.
A striped variation of the table.

Disables the warning message on development console when a responsive stackable table cell does not contain an `id` or `headers`.
It's recommended that accessibility with screen readers is tested to ensure the stacked table meets the requirement.
The table body contents, usually `TableRow`.
The table caption contents.
Additional classes to be added to the caption element.
@hide-prop This gets passed from the parent `Table` component when the table `scrollable` prop is set.
@hide-prop This gets passed from the parent `Table` component when the table `scrollable` prop is set.
@hide-prop This gets passed from the parent `Table` component when the table `scrollable` prop is set.
Set the text-align on the table cell content. Options: left, center, right.
The table cell contents.

When provided, this will render the passed in component as the HTML element.
If this prop is undefined, it renders a `<th>` element if the parent component is `TableHead`,
otherwise, it renders a `<td>` element.
Additional classes to be added to the row element.

`TableCell` must define a `headers` prop for stackable tables with a `<td>` element.
The `headers` prop associates header and data cells for screen readers.
`headers` consist of a list of space-separated ids that each correspond to a `<td>` element.
[Read more about the headers attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/td#Attributes).

`TableCell` must define an `id` prop for stackable tables with a `<th>` element.
The `id` prop associates header and data cells for screen readers.

If this prop is undefined, the component sets a scope attribute of `col` when the parent
component is `TableHead` to identify the header cell is a header for a column.
Additional classes to be added to the stacked Title element.

Table data cell's corresponding header title, this stacked title is displayed as the row header
when a responsive table is vertically stacked.
@hide-prop This gets set from the parent `TableHead` component
The table head contents, usually `TableRow`.
The table row contents, usually `TableCell`.
@hide-prop This gets set from the parent `TableHead`
Label text or HTML.

An array of [step objects]({{root}}/patterns/step-list/#patterns.step-list.step-object) that contain
text, state, [link/button URLs]({{root}}/patterns/step-list/#patterns.step-list.buttons) and other info needed to render steps.

When provided, this will render the passed in component for all link elements. This is useful when
integrating with React Router's `<Link>` or using your own custom component.
If more specific control is needed, each `step` object also accepts a `component` prop.
Whether or not to render a substep's substeps.

Function called when a step's Edit, Start, or Resume button/link is
clicked. The step's `href` property will be passed as a parameter.

A template string for the aria-label describing a step's actions where
the substring `%{step}` is replaced with that step's `heading`.

A template string for the aria-label for a step's description where
the substring `%{step}` is replaced with that step's `heading`.

A template string for the aria-label describing a step's substeps where
the substring `%{step}` is replaced with that step's `heading`.
The text announced to screen readers

Additional classes to be added to the spinner element.
Useful for adding utility classes.
Applies the inverse theme styling
Adds a background behind the spinner for extra contrast
Landmark role so the spinner can receive keyboard focus
Smaller or larger variant
Skip nav label
The anchor or target for the link (where the link will jump the user to)

An onClick handler used for manually setting focus on the content.
Sometimes it's necessary to manually set focus, like when an app uses hash
routing and element-id links will be mistaken for routes.
`Review` component's body content.

Optional label to give screenreaders longer, more descriptive text to
explain the context of an edit link.
An optional node in place of the edit link. If this defined, no edit link will be shown.
Href for the edit link. If this is undefined, no edit link will be shown.
Heading type to override default `<h3>`.

An optional function that is executed on edit link click. The event and
props.editHref value are passed to this function.

Provide this value to give screenreaders longer, more descriptive text to
explain the context of the link.
Defines the page number.
Renders current page if true, other links if false.
A callback function used to handle state changes.
Defines application-specific routing in url for links.
Defines `aria-label` on wrapping Pagination element. Since this exists on a `<nav>` element, the word "navigation" should be omitted from this label. Optional.
Class to be applied to parent `<nav>` element of Pagination component. Optional.
Renders compact layout. Optional.
Defines active page in Pagination. Optional.
Determines if navigation is hidden when current page is the first or last of Pagination page set. Optional.
A callback function used to handle state changes.
Defines application-specific routing in url for links.
Sets custom label on start navigation. Added for language support. Optional.
Sets custom ARIA label on start navigation. Added for language support. Label structure should be the equivalent of: Previous Page. Optional.
Sets custom label on end navigation. Added for language support. Optional.
Sets custom ARIA label on end navigation. Added for language support. Label structure should be the equivalent of: Next Page. Optional.
Sets total number of pages in Pagination component.
Function called to close dialog.

Determines which native dialog method is called to open the dialog. If the dialog
is opened with `showModal`, focus will be trapped inside the dialog, and it will
need to be closed before the rest of the page can be interacted with. See the
[`showModal` MDN documentation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLDialogElement/showModal)
for more details.
The `input` field's `name` attribute
Additional classes to be added to the root element.
Variation string to be applied to buttons. See [Button component]({{root}}/components/button/#components.button.react)

Array of month numbers, where `1` is January, and any month included
is disabled for selection.

Array of month numbers, where `1` is January, and any month included
is selected. This will render a read-only field. If the field should
be mutable, use `defaultSelectedMonths`.

Array of month numbers, where `1` is January, and any month included
is selected by default. Sets the initial checked state for the 12 month
checkboxes. Use this for an uncontrolled component; otherwise, use the
`selectedMonths` property.

A callback function that's invoked when a month's checked state is changed.
Note: This callback is not called when a month is selected or deselected
via the "Select all" or "Clear all" buttons – use the `onSelectAll` and
`onClearAll` event handlers for those instances.
The text for the "Select all" button for internationalization
The text for the "Clear all" button for internationalization
The text for the dialog's 'close' button
The text for the 'continue session' button in warning dialog.
The heading text for the warning dialog.
The text for the button that ends the session in warning dialog.
The URL to direct to when the user intentionally ends the session.

A formatting function that returns the string to be used in the warning modal.
The formatting function is provided the timeTilTimeout (in minutes).

Optional function that is called when the user chooses to keep the session alive. This function is called by the 'continue session' button or the 'close' button.
The IdleTimeout component will reset the countdown internally.

Optional function that is called when the session is manually ended by user.
If not provided, the behavior of `onTimeout` will be used.
Function that is called when the timeout countdown reaches zero.
Describes if the button to manually end session should be shown in the warning dialog.
Defines the amount of minutes of idle activity until the session is timed out
Defines the amount of minutes of idle activity that will trigger the warning message.
The text for the dialog's 'close' button
The text for the 'continue session' button in warning dialog.
The heading text for the warning dialog.
The text for the button that ends the session in warning dialog.

The message text for the warning dialog.
Note that using the token `<timeToTimeout>` will be replaced in the message text with the number of minutes until timeout.
Function that is called when the user select the 'close' button for the dialog

Function that is called when the user chooses to keep the session alive.
The IdleTimeout component will reset the countdown internally.

Optional function that is called when the session is manually ended by user.
If not provided, the behavior of `onTimeout` will be used.
Describes if the button to manually end session should be shown

Describes the value of the `aria-hidden` attribute on the SVG. Defaulted to true with the assumption that most icons are decorative.
If the icon does not have any associated label text, set this to `false` and ensure a `title` is provided for improved accessibility.
Additional CSS classes to be added to the svg element
The elements that make up the SVG
Long-text description of any SVG. Use for complex icons, otherwise `title` prop will suffice.
A custom `id` attribute for the SVG
If `true` sets inverse fill color.
The descriptive name for the SVG icon

A string describing the viewbox of the SVG.

It is recommended that the icon is centered and fill up the default viewport size.
See [this blog post](https://webdesign.tutsplus.com/tutorials/svg-viewport-and-viewbox-for-beginners--cms-30844) for further explanation on viewBox and how to use it.
Analytics events tracking is enabled by default. Set this value to `false` to disable tracking for this component instance.

An override for the dynamic content sent to analytics services. By default this content comes from the heading.

In cases where this component’s heading may contain **sensitive information**, use this prop to override what is sent to analytics.
@hide-prop [Deprecated] This prop has been renamed to `heading`.

Whether or not the Help Drawer controlled by this toggle is open or closed.
This value is used to re-focus the toggle that opened the drawer when the drawer closes.
Icon to be included at the end of the toggle's text
Label text or HTML.
Additional classes to be added to the root element.
The root HTML element used to render the label
Enable the error state by providing an error message.
Additional classes to be added to the error message
The ID of the error message applied to this field.

The ID of the field this label is for. This is used for the label's `for`
attribute and any related ARIA attributes, such as for the error message.
Additional hint text to display

A unique `id` for the label element. Useful for referencing the label from
other components with `aria-describedby`.
Set to `true` to apply the "inverse" theme

Text showing the requirement (ie. "Optional", or "Required").
In most cases, this should be used to indicate which fields are optional.
See the [form guidelines]({{root}}/guidelines/forms/) for more info.
Additional classes to be added to the label text.
Additional classes to be added to the field container.
The HTML element used to render the container
A unique ID to be used for the error message. If one isn't provided, a unique ID will be generated.
Additional classes to be added to the error message
Location of the error message relative to the field input
Used to focus the field input on `componentDidMount()`
Additional hint text to display
A unique ID to be used for the field input. If one isn't provided, a unique ID will be generated.
Access a reference to the field input
Applies the "inverse" UI theme
Label for the field.
Additional classes to be added to the field label
The root HTML element used to render the field label
A unique `id` to be used on the field label. If one isn't provided, a unique ID will be generated.
Text showing the requirement ("Required", "Optional", etc.). See [Required and Optional Fields]({{root}}/guidelines/forms/#required-and-optional-fields).
A function that returns a field input element to accept render props
Id for filter chip button. If not provided, a unique id will be automatically generated and used.
Class to be applied to the outer `<div>` that contains filter chip button.
Text for the filter chip.
Labels filter action, i.e., "Remove." For screenreader support.
Function to call when filter chip is dismissed.
Use alternate thinner close icon in place of standard.
Sets the size of the chip to larger version.
Adds `aria-label` attribute. When using `aria-label`, `label` should be empty string.
Additional classes to be added to the root element.
Used to define custom dropdown options (i.e. option groups). When using the `children` prop, `options` should be an empty list.

Sets the initial selected state. Use this for an uncontrolled component;
otherwise, use the `value` property.
Disables the entire field.
Additional classes to be added to the error message
Location of the error message relative to the field input
Additional classes to be added to the select element
Used to focus `select` on `componentDidMount()`
Additional hint text to display
A unique ID to be used for the dropdown field. If one isn't provided, a unique ID will be generated.
Access a reference to the `select` element
Applies the "inverse" UI theme
Label for the field. If using `Dropdown` without a label, provide an empty string for `label` and use the `ariaLabel` prop instead.
Additional classes to be added to the `FormLabel`.
The field's `name` attribute
The list of options to be rendered. Provide an empty list if using custom options via the `children` prop.
Text showing the requirement ("Required", "Optional", etc.). See [Required and Optional Fields]({{root}}/guidelines/forms/#required-and-optional-fields).
If the component renders a select, set the max-width of the input either to `'small'` or `'medium'`.

Sets the field's `value`. Use this in combination with `onChange`
for a controlled component; otherwise, set `defaultValue`.
Adds `aria-label` attribute. When using `aria-label`, `label` should be empty string.
Used to define custom Select options (i.e. option groups). When using the `children` prop, `options` should be an empty list.

Sets the initial selected state. Use this for an uncontrolled component;
otherwise, use the `value` property.
Disables the entire field.
The ID of the error message applied to the Select field.
Location of the error message relative to the field input
Additional classes to be added to the select element
A unique ID to be used for the Select field.
Applies the "inverse" UI theme
The field's `name` attribute
The list of options to be rendered. Provide an empty list if using custom options via the `children` prop.
If the component renders a select, set the max-width of the input either to `'small'` or `'medium'`.

Sets the field's `value`. Use this in combination with `onChange`
for a controlled component; otherwise, set `defaultValue`.
Gives more context to screen readers on the Drawer close button.
Enables focus trap functionality within Drawer.
Text for the Drawer heading. Required because the `heading` will be focused on mount.
A unique `id` to be used on heading element to label multiple instances of Drawer.
Heading type to override default `<h3>`
Ref to heading element
Enables "sticky" position of Drawer header element.
Enables "sticky" position of Drawer footer element.

Determines if Drawer is open or closed.
This value is used to re-focus the toggle that opened the drawer when the drawer closes.
DrawerToggle content.
Additional classes for the toggle button anchor element.
Adds `display: inline` to the DrawerToggle.

This function is called with an id that the toggle generates.
It can be used in implementing the Drawer for keeping track of which drawer the toggle controls.

If true, the modal will receive a role of alertdialog,
instead of its default dialog.

By default, the modal is active when mounted, deactivated when unmounted.
However, you can also control its active/inactive state by changing
its mounted property instead.

Provide your main application node here (which the modal should
render outside of), and when the modal is open this application
node will receive the attribute `aria-hidden="true"`.
This can help screen readers understand what's going on.

By default, styles are applied inline to the dialog and underlay
portions of the component. However, you can disable all inline
styles by setting `includeDefaultStyles` to false. If set, you
must specify all styles externally, including positioning.
This is helpful if your project uses external CSS assets.

_Note_: underlayStyle and dialogStyle can still be set inline,
but these will be the only styles applied.

Apply a class to the dialog in order to custom-style it.

Be aware that, _by default_, this module does apply various
inline styles to the dialog element in order position it.
To disable _all inline styles_, see `includeDefaultStyles`.

Choose your own id attribute for the dialog element.

Default: `react-aria-modal-dialog`.
Customize properties of the style prop that is passed to the dialog.

By default, when the modal activates its first focusable child will
receive focus. However, if `focusDialog` is true, the dialog itself
will receive initial focus — and that focus will be hidden.
(This is essentially what Bootstrap does with their modal.)

By default, when the modal activates its first focusable child will
receive focus. If, instead, you want to identify a specific element
that should receive initial focus, pass a selector string to this
prop. (That selector is passed to `document.querySelector()` to find
the DOM node.)

A string to use as the modal's accessible title. This value is passed
to the modal's `aria-label` attribute. You must use either `titleId` or
`titleText`, but not both.

The `id` of the element that should be used as the modal's accessible
title. This value is passed to the modal's `aria-labelledby` attribute.
You must use either `titleId` or `titleText`, but not both.

Customize properties of the `style` prop that is passed to the underlay.
The best way to add some vertical displacement to the dialog is to add
top & bottom padding to the underlay.
This is illustrated in the demo examples.

Apply a class to the underlay in order to custom-style it.
This module does apply various inline styles, though, so be aware that
overriding some styles might be difficult. If, for example, you want
to change the underlay's color, you should probably use the
`underlayColor` prop instead of a class.
If you would rather control all CSS, see `includeDefaultStyles`.

By default, a click on the underlay will exit the modal.
Pass `false`, and clicking on the underlay will do nothing.
By default, the Escape key exits the modal. Pass `false`, and it won't.

If you want to change the underlay's color, you can
do that with this prop. If `false`, no background color will be
applied with inline styles. Presumably you will apply then
yourself via an `underlayClass`.

Default: rgba(0,0,0,0.5)
If `true`, the modal's contents will be vertically (as well as horizontally) centered.

Customize properties of the focusTrapOptions prop that is passed to the modal dialog's focus trap.
For example, you can use this prop if you need better control of where focus is returned.
If true, the modal dialog will prevent any scrolling behind the modal window.
Analytics events tracking is enabled by default. Set this value to `false` to disable tracking for this component instance.

An override for the dynamic content sent to analytics services. By default this content comes from the heading.

In cases where this component’s heading may contain **sensitive information**, use this prop to override what is sent to analytics.

Buttons or other HTML to be rendered in the "actions" bar
at the bottom of the dialog.
Additional classes to be added to the actions container.
Aria label for the close button
Additional classes to be added to the root dialog element.
Size of the close button. See [Button component]({{root}}/components/button/#components.button.react)

For internationalization purposes, the text for the "Close" button must be
passed in as a prop.
Variation string to be applied to close button component. See [Button component]({{root}}/components/button/#components.button.react)
The icon to display as part of the close button

@hide-prop [Deprecated] This prop has been renamed to `closeButtonText`

Adds `autocomplete` attributes `bday-day`, `bday-month` and `bday-year` to the corresponding `<DateInput>` inputs
Additional classes to be added to the root fieldset element

Optional method to format the `input` field values. If this
method is provided, the returned value will be passed as a second argument
to the `onBlur` and `onChange` callbacks. This method receives an object as
its only argument, in the shape of: `{ day, month, year }`
By default `dateFormatter` will be set to the `defaultDateFormatter` function, which prevents days/months more than 2 digits & years more than 4 digits.
Disables all three input fields.

Called anytime any date input is blurred

Called anytime any date input is changed. This function is called with two arguments.
The first argument should be used to update whatever state your application uses to
supply back to this component's `value` prop in a _controlled component_ pattern.

Sets the input's `value`. Use in combination with an `onChange` handler to implement
a _controlled component_ pattern. This component expects the `value` to match
whatever string the user types (i.e., the first argument provided to your `onChange`
handler).

Analytics events tracking is enabled by default. Set this value to `false` to
disable tracking for this component instance.

An override for the dynamic content sent to analytics services. By default this content comes from the heading.

In cases where this component’s heading may contain **sensitive information**, use this prop to override what is sent to analytics.
If needed for analytics, pass heading text of parent component of button.
If needed for analytics, pass type of parent component of button.

rather than `button`.

uses the `main` color.

Returns the [`SyntheticEvent`](https://facebook.github.io/react/docs/events.html).
Not called when the button is disabled.

Control the `TextField` autocomplete attribute. Defaults to "off" to support accessibility. [Read more.](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Security/Securing_your_site/Turning_off_form_autocompletion)
Must contain a `TextField` component

Additional classes to be added to the root element.
Useful for adding utility classes.
When set to `false`, do not clear the input when the input element loses focus.
Text rendered on the page if `clearInput` prop is passed. Default is "Clear search".
Removes the Clear search button when set to `false`
Used to focus child `TextField` on `componentDidMount()`

A unique id to be passed to the child `TextField`. If no id is passed as a prop,
the `Autocomplete` component will auto-generate one. This prop was provided in cases
where an id might need to be passed to multiple components, such as the `htmlFor`
attribute on a label and the id of an input.

Customize the default status messages announced to screenreader users via aria-live when autocomplete results are populated. [Read more on downshift docs.](https://github.com/paypal/downshift#geta11ystatusmessage)
Access a reference to the child `TextField`'s `input` element
Used to determine the string value for the selected item (which is used to compute the `inputValue`). [Read more on downshift docs.](https://github.com/paypal/downshift#itemtostring)

Array of objects used to populate the suggestion list that appears below the input as users type. This array of objects is intended for an async data callback, and should conform to the prescribed shape to avoid errors.
Adds a heading to the top of the autocomplete list. This can be used to convey to the user that they're required to select an option from the autocomplete list.
A unique `id` to be used on the child `TextField` label tag
Can be called when the `items` array is being fetched remotely, or will be delayed for more than 1-2 seconds.
Message users will see when the `loading` prop is passed to `Autocomplete`.
Message users will see when the `items` array returns empty and the `loading` prop is passed to `<Autocomplete />`.

Called when the user selects an item and the selected item has changed. Called with the item that was selected and the new state. [Read more on downshift docs.](https://github.com/paypal/downshift#onchange)
Called when the child `TextField` value changes. Returns a String `inputValue`. [Read more on downshift docs.](https://github.com/paypal/downshift#oninputvaluechange)
Access a reference to the `alert` `div` element
